action.action-desc: Mr. Bacon introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of a military department to provide certain support to a foundation that supports a Military Service Academy.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Military Service Academy Foundation Support Act of 2022.

section.header: Authorization of certain support for military service academy foundations

subsection.text: Subchapter I of chapter 134 of title 10, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 2245 the end the following new section:

section.header: Authorization of certain support for military service academy foundations

subsection.text: Subject to subsection (b), the Secretary of the military department concerned may provide the following support to a covered foundation:

paragraph.text: The use, on an unreimbursed basis, of facilities or equipment of the United States by the covered foundation, authorized by any—

subparagraph.text: Senior Executive Service employee assigned to the Service Academy supported by that covered foundation; or
official designated by the Secretary concerned.

paragraph.text: Endorsement by an individual described in paragraph (1) of—

subparagraph.text: an event of the covered foundation; or
an activity of the covered foundation.

subsection.text: Support under subsection (a) may be provided only if such support—

paragraph.text: is without any liability of the United States to the covered foundation;

does not affect the ability of any official or employee of the military department concerned, or any member of the Armed Forces, to carry out any responsibility or duty in a fair and objective manner;
does not compromise the integrity or appearance of integrity of any program of the military department concerned, or any individual involved in such a program; and
does not include the participation of any cadet or midshipman, other than participation in an honor guard at an event of the covered foundation.

subsection.text: In any fiscal year during which support is provided under subsection (a), the Secretary of the military department concerned shall provide a briefing not later than the last day of that fiscal year to the congressional defense committees regarding the number of events or activities of a covered foundation in which an individual described in subsection (a)(1) participated during such fiscal year.

paragraph.text: The term covered foundation means a charitable, educational, or civic nonprofit organization under section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, that the Secretary concerned determines operates exclusively to support, with respect to a Service Academy, any of the following:
The term Service Academy has the meaning given such term in section 347 of this title.

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of such subchapter is amended by inserting after the item relating to item 2245 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 2246. Authorization of certain support for military service academy foundations.
